task.title: Configuring the Automated Workflow Trigger
task.shortdesc: Configure the Automated Workflow Trigger to automatically launch a workflow when critical events, such as an internet blackout or database data loss are detected in SecureNova

context.p: The Automated Workflow Trigger enables administrators to automate responses to critical events by defining conditions that initiate workflows, such as notifying a team or escalating an issue. Use the SecureNova Workflow Studio to set up the trigger.

step.cmd: Navigate to Workflow Studio in the SecureNova platform and select Create New Trigger.
In the Trigger Conditions selection, select Event Type and choose Critical Event (e.g., Internet Blackout or Database Data Loss).

info.note: Verify the event type matches your organization's monitoring system.

step.cmd: Define the Workflow to activate, such as Notify IT Team or Initiate Recovery Process, and link it to the trigger.
Test the trigger by simulating a critical event in the Test Environment to ensure the workflow launches correctly.
Save and activate the trigger by clicking Publish in Workflow Studio.

result.p: Once activated, the Automated Workflow Trigger will automatically initiate the specified workflow whenever the defined critical event occurs, ensuring rapid response.

postreq.p: If you have questions or encounter issues, contact SecureNova support via email admincontrol@securenova.com, through the Admin Portal or consult the Workflow Trigger Documentation. If the trigger doesn't activate, verify the event type settings in Trigger Conditions or check the System Logs for errors.
